title: Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

last_post.content:
I am going to keep posting about this until we get to 100,000 signatures.

So,you have seen posts like this before and you are getting bored of seeing it. However, the rate of increase in the number of votes is decreasing. I know we can do this, so please help me out.

As I write there are 87,960 signatures. The linear trend line of signatures from Tuesday 31 January gives an equation of
y = 1076.9x + 82277.
That means the date for hitting 100,000 votes has drifted out three days to Wednesday 15 February. I know we can do better than this. The last we thing we want is the petition to remove LGBT content from the curriculum to be debated and our opinion not to be heard.

Please sign if you are in the UK and please boost if you are not.

May I take this opportunity to thank each and everyone of the 900 people that have boosted this post so far. ❤️ ❤️

Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/631529

#TransRightsAreHumanrRghts #Trans

title: Unable to burn digital books, Orange Unified School District bans the whole virtual library | Boing Boing

last_post.content:
One thing I'll say for the wave of Republican book-banning that's going on right now -- it's certainly making books seem powerful and *significant*

Book-banning is of course a terrible way to have the public re-realize the catalytic effect a good book can have on its readers

Nonetheless, here we are: https://boingboing.net/2023/01/31/unable-to-burn-digital-books-orange-unified-school-district-bans-the-whole-virtual-library.html

title: 4chan users embrace AI voice clone tool to generate celebrity hatespeech

last_post.content:
It's 2023. "Gosh, we didn't realize how people would misuse this" just isn't believable anymore.

Bare minimum, with any new tech:
1) How would a stalker use this?
2) What will 4chan do with this?

And don't release, not even as alpha or beta, before mitigating those risks.

https://www.theverge.com/2023/1/31/23579289/ai-voice-clone-deepfake-abuse-4chan-elevenlabs

#AIethics #ethNLP

title: arXiv announces new policy on ChatGPT and similar tools – arXiv.org blog

last_post.content:
ArXiv issues new policy on large language models as authors: https://blog.arxiv.org/2023/01/31/arxiv-announces-new-policy-on-chatgpt-and-similar-tools/

TL;DR: no, language models cannot take responsibility for the content of a paper and therefore cannot be listed as an author

title: Getty Images v. Stability AI - Complaint

last_post.content: BREAKING: Getty Images just filed a copyright and trademark infringement lawsuit against Stability AI in Delaware District Court. Getty alleges that Stability copied more than 12 million Getty photos to train Stable Diffusion. Full complaint here: https://copyrightlately.com/pdfviewer/getty-images-v-stability-ai-complaint/

title: https://cheapbotstootsweet.com

last_post.content: https://CheapBotsTootSweet.com is up and running if any #botALLY wants to clone or take their CBDQ babies off Twitter, or make a new Mastobot with no muss and no fuss. Also lmk if you're ok having your source linked as an example on the front page!

title: From the Community | Stanford needs an official Mastodon server

last_post.content:
Stanford student @tguarna is calling for Stanford University to host its own Mastodon server.

The reason is simple: Twitter is no longer reliable as communications infrastructure.

Academics and researchers need reliable communications infrastructure.

And it's time for universities like Stanford to ensure the reliability of their communications!

https://stanforddaily.com/2023/02/02/from-the-community-stanford-needs-an-official-mastodon-server/

title: Create a release checklist in a GitHub issue — use_release_issue

last_post.content:
today's #rstats function you might not know about:

usethis::use_release_issue() creates a GH issue with a common-sense checklist of steps to follow while releasing a package

as someone prone to making mistakes during fiddly, repetitive processes like releases, following these checklists has saved me so much time & angst about breaking the CRAN release

https://usethis.r-lib.org/reference/use_release_issue.html

title: Harvard Misinformation Expert Joan Donovan Forced to Leave by Kennedy School Dean, Sources Say | News | The Harvard Crimson

last_post.content:
Harvard is shutting down prominent misinformation expert Joan Donovan's project, forcing her out of her research director position. The project has a team >25 people—led by Donovan since 2019.

Donovan was told that her prominence led to the Dean's decision to remove her. The Center Director said in an email that the decision "was 'solely driven' by [the] policy of only allowing full professors to lead research projects."

via https://www.thecrimson.com/article/2023/2/2/donovan-forced-leave-hks/
h/t @ct_bergstrom
@academicchatter #Science

title: messaging-custom-newsletters.n...

last_post.content:
I'm here for downward-pointing bars for numbers that represent something bad or negative. It's so much more logical than showing them pointing up, and more down = more bad is so much more immediate.

title: Elon Musk Is Pulling the Plug on a Tool That Made Twitter Great

last_post.content: Twitter's API is part of what made the platform great. title: The loss of Twitter's free API tier is a blow to activists and researchers.

last_post.content:
I talked with Mashable about how accessibility bots will be affected by Twitter charging for API access. The decision sidelines and shuts down most bots, though I hope to keep one of my bots running. #a11y

https://mashable.com/article/twitter-api-accessibility-bots
